snippet: The next generation of prostheses includes artificial arms with flexible fingers sensitive enough to transmit the sensation of texture.
abstract: John Hopkins University engineers have developed next generation of prosthetic, robotic arms controlled by amputee's brain signals; users report they can feel texture through the arms, known as Modular Prosthetic Limbs.
lead_paragraph: The next generation of prostheses includes artificial arms with flexible fingers sensitive enough to transmit the sensation of texture.
